title: Which is the better offer, three successive discounts of 10%, 10 and 30% or three successive discounts of 40%, 5% and 5%? - Quora

response.answer_text: Let the cost price be x. Then with the first discount scheme of discounts of 10%, 10% and 33% successively, the final cost price will be = x * .90 *.90 * .70 = 0.567x = 56.7% of x Discount offered will be = 100 - 56.7 = 43.3% of x With the second discount scheme of discounts, 40%, 5% ,5% successively, the final cost price will be = x * .6 * .95 * .95 = 0.5415x = 54.15% of x. Discount offered will be = 100 - 54.15 = 45.85% Hence the second scheme gives better discounts.
